name: Shogo Sakai
comment: I‚Äôm really honored to have been invited to participate in this project to celebrate KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary.

name: R-Man
comment: KodamaSounds means a lot to me, and I have truly enjoyed seeing it grow over the past five years. As a founder and manager of Resonant Union, I can truly relate to the struggles and challenges, as well as the victories and joys of organising a group like this. I feel it's truly a privilege to get to be part of a community like this. Thank you for having me. Here's to five more excellent years!

name: Justin Thornburgh
comment: KodamaSounds projects are always really nicely themed and there's nice variety in projects. The artists that come together to participate on these projects are great, so it's fun to be a part of it.

name: Zohka
comment: Until today, I‚Äôve only contributed to a single KodamaSounds project. I really like the song I made for that project, but it sounded like what you can usually expect of me. Thinking back on it, I think it lacked something fresh. The restrictions being this lax for this new project made it an interesting challenge, and I was able to go beyond my limits to make something new.

name: MB
comment: I came to be involved with KodamaSounds via my activities with Resonant Union, as our contributing artists often participated on both groups' projects. I actually feel a bit bad since most of my conributions to KodamaSounds have been past works that I haven't found the opportunity to release independently ("leftovers" so to speak), and my submission for YGGDRASIL won't be any different, haha. That said, I'm truly grateful that Robin has been willing to accept and release these past compositions of mine on KodamaSounds' albums, and it's an honour to be part of such a large and growing group.

name: SpiralFlip
comment: It's been fun to write some songs for KodamaSounds üëç

name: Philip Saguil
comment: I've had the pleasure of contributing to one Kodama album every year since 2022. I enjoy the original composition projects the circle releases under ECLECTIC RESONANCE, and I hope to contribute to more in the future! Building up Resonant Union next to KodamaSounds, I've always viewed this group as a sister to our own. I am very happy to see them reach larger audiences as the years continue on, and can't wait to see what they become in the future.

name: YOKAI
comment: I arrived at Kodama two years ago now, but it feels like so much longer! This year has been the most important one for me, with the release of my third album under the circle. This album was even pressed and distributed in Japan! It‚Äôs a dream I‚Äôve had for a long time, one I thought was unattainable until now but the stars aligned with the live presentation of the album for M3. One aspect I particularly appreciate about Kodama is the natural kindness of its members, a strong sense of mutual support and community that encourages you to push yourself further. Even though we compose on our own, there are always plenty of members available. Personally, I find this amazing because I love creating alone but surrounding myself with others when it‚Äôs needed. A big thank you to Kodama for everything it brings me, both creatively and personally, in my own individual growth!

name: eili
comment: I was really honored to be invited to such a special achievement. Anytime an indie studio sees success, it makes me just a little bit happier. I was glad to be a part of it.

name: v1ris
comment: The online VGM community has changed my life, and KodamaSounds is absolutely an instrumental part of that since I've started getting involved with it over the past year! There are so many wonderful people I've met through it, and it's always an honor and a privilege to have contributed to its projects, whether I'm arranging/composing, or playing violin (which you can hear me play on YGGDRASIL!)

name: takehirotei
comment: I haven't provided much songs or remixes, but it was a fun experience to try out different things

name: Garrrros
comment: I am grateful for the opportunity to contribute to KodamaSounds' amazing releases, and I am very impressed by the sheer amount of passion and dedication the artists involved show when it comes to producing fanworks under the label. KodamaSounds keeps on proving that it is a fabulous, precious and incredible project. Bravo!!!

name: LkProd
comment: Although my contributions weren't as relevant as that of the actual musicians involved with each release, it was a joy having the opportunity to work on DJ Koishi and ECLECTIC RESONANCE PARADISE, the latter being an album focused on genres I personally love. It's been really damn cool seeing the label growing more and more with each release, seeing cool names putting out fresh new bangers with each album, and getting to see some projects (including one I worked on) being physically sold in Japan is just plain surreal. Very excited to listen to what YGGDRASIL has to offer, and here's to plenty more years of #KODAMASWEEP!

name: Damare
comment: Although I'm a turbo lurker and haven't taken part in many kodama releases in recent years, I'd secretly contribute a major part of my improvement in music to the environment of kodamasounds (I am extremely fueled by envy thus being around very talented musicians and composers 300 times better than myself has lit a fire under me)

name: vervid!
comment: although I have been around the kodamasounds community for a while now, just the thought of me standing side-by-side with the many artists I look up to in the past feels sort of surreal. it feels sort of amazing having my works published under kodamasounds - not only it expanded my portfolio of sounds, it also achieved my dream of having one of my works featured on M3, which is something I've been keeping an eye on even BEFORE I started on my music production journey. it's been a wild ride so far, and I'm really looking forward to your future projects that I can potentially take part of!

name: Yamajet
comment: The world tree‚Äôs roots spread‚Ä¶ Congratulations for the 5th anniversary! I‚Äôm really happy to have been invited from the other side of the world. Before I noticed, KodamaSounds became an important part of my life. Let‚Äôs keep the train going and aim for the 500th anniversary!

name: WujuBlade
comment: About my track, I really love composing piano tracks in my spare time. As I was practicing composing, i decided to make this song for this Anniversary and thought it was a good idea to show something really unique that I rarely make. I'm happy to show it off in this anniversary. Thank you for having me! :D

name: intelligencecasino
comment: Congratulations on your 5th anniversary!!! It's been so much fun making music with you guys ^____^

name: Yumi Sakata
comment: Kodama has always been the perfect place to really push my composition. Being part of the VGM arrangement scene, there's always this sense of limiting, be it genre wise, or making sure you can still hear parts of the original composition. With Kodama, even with the VGM arrangement projects, it always feels like it is encouraged to strive to push boundaries, even if it doesn't make sense. Yggdrasil, I feel, is the project that is really saying "go wild", and to have several artists on this project go wild is going to create something unforgettable. Happy 5th anniversary Kodama!!!

name: KoDyMaxx
comment: We have been a part of KodamaSounds since near the beginning and we have come a long way since then. This project is a love letter to the great times making music under KodamaSounds until now and for the future. Thanks for having such a lovely community and for all those amazing opportunities. Happy 5th anniversary and to many more years to come!

name: Levc_EGM
comment: Despite considering myself as the one that is always "out of place" in most albums, I was invited to contribute something to this special occasion. I was given this golden opportunity to make whatever my heart desires, and what it desires the most is "video game chaos"... So I did just that! (I don't think this solves my own problem of feeling out of place lmao.) In general, I haven't been in the best place mentally. I wrote a whole blog about how I "gave up" trying to reach people with my music. And yet, getting invited cheered me up enough to make something incredible, and I think that's the best thing about working with KodamaSounds. They're a group of people who love making music of all kinds. And that love is contagious, it inspires everyone to keep making music. I think that's what matters most. So despite my own self doubt, I made something that I think is great, the coolest song I've put together so far. And I hope everyone in KodamaSounds, including myself, keep making amazing music that inspires others forever.

name: HAGANE
comment: I‚Äôve written a lot of music over the past five years. I want to keep making music for the rest of my life, and I‚Äôd love to keep walking this path together with KodamaSounds.

name: MilkyChan
comment: Ever since this project started, I've been in awe of the sheer organizational power that is put on display. Putting out all of these amazing albums and bringing together so many people and their music is nothing short of impressive. I'd also like to give my personal thanks, because Kodama Albums are what got me out of terrible musical slumps which I may not have overcome by myself. Onto many more cool projects!

name: Tee-vee
comment: In 2020 I stumbled on a twitter post calling for musicians for a Touhou arrange compilation organized by a french community, and 5 years later I'm still here doing my silly tunes for it. Somehow it feels both like an eternity ago AND like it wasn't that long ago. Happy birthday KodamaSounds!! The output of this circle over just these few years has been crazy and it's always a pleasure to see it grow and to contribute when I can. Happy to have met many cool peeps thanks to it as well. My gratitude and apologies to Robin for bearing with my slow chronically late ass struggling with hard deadlines. insert "I'm sorry, it will happen again" meme. happy bappy xoxo tv

name: ne_pura
comment: love me some music love me super cool music love me kodama :)

name: Aniel
comment: I first took part in a Kodama‚Äôs project with ECLECTIC RESONANCE hollow horizons. Kodama is a really interesting label, with lots of different music that people express their own way!

name: AIKATYPE
comment: Lots of things to say, I don't even know where to start. I wouldn't be able to type it all out. I am grateful for Kodama's existence.

name: Nuchuu
comment: KodamaSounds publishes so many talented musicians, producers, alike, and it is with my whole heart I present Amaranthine to represent just a portion of KodamaSounds. I chose specifically a track I was passionate about, and one specifically I had failed to finish 5 years ago when I was much more new to music production, to bring back to life for KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary celebration. As reference to the divine nature of the mythological YGGDRASIL, I chose to represent forms of investment into divinity within my work. I also chose to combine new and old, as KodamaSounds does itself in its albums of wide varieties of music, and albums of celebrating modern culture. KodamaSounds was one of the first consistently professional quality music publishing groups I ever contributed to, and I am very grateful for these opportunities to make what I am passionate about alongside other talented musicians. May music connect us as YGGDRASIL connects the realms.

name: Lollipop
comment: Five years‚Äîthat's a long time, isn't it? Since becoming a member of the KodamaSounds family in 2022 (w/ Moriya Barista), I've come to appreciate that everyone here truly excels at producing great tunes and doing great things. I'm honored to have had the opportunity to feature in previous albums, and to also have my track included in this ambitious project. Like most pursuits in life, making music has had its requisite share of ups and downs‚Äîwho knows if I'll still be doing this in another five years? But, like the title of my track, I'll strive first and foremost to continue to follow my heart, going wherever it goes. A myriad thanks to Fivda and the rest of the KodamaSounds staff for making all this possible, and here's to more great tunes and albums in the future!

name: Ren
comment: I've been lucky enough to participate on three previous KodamaSounds albums (ECLECTIC RESONANCE ~Dusk~, Moriya Barista, and VANTABLACK 2), and hopefully more to come. I think the number of amazing artists who have worked on so many quality releases over the years is a testament to the work ethic and attention to detail of the KodamaSounds team. Here's to their continued success!

name: wrashi
comment: I could experience a lot of new things with Kodama‚Äôs projects! Thank you very much!

name: HEAVYVIPER
comment: I have only contributed a few pieces to KodamaSounds projects at this point. Having started out in chiptune, I am very pleased to have been featured alongside the other spectacular artists on the "ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories" albums. Having also been featured on the second "UPRISING" release, I can't say I feel I'm on the same level as other contributors, though the energy on display makes me want to get better! It's been wonderful to be associated with a circle that resonates such positive energy, and I'm always excited to see each new release. For YGGDRASIL, I tried not to come in with any preconception of what I should make. I did my best to sit down and let something come out. I had recently bought a Korg opsix as a hardware synth and controller, and decided to put it to work here. Almost all elements of the track, save for percussion and effects, were generated and recorded from the opsix. I usually work exclusively with softsynths, so the change of pace was invigorating! I ended up with something pretty airy, floating somewhere between techno and trance. I was expecting to make something harder if I'm honest, but perhaps I'm stuck in the clouds... I am at a point in my life where I am forced to balance my creative spirit with harsh realities and responsibilities. This circle has helped me maintain that balance. It's been a pleasure to contribute what I can, and I hope to do so well into the future. Happy 5th, KodamaSounds!! o(*Ôø£‚ñΩÔø£*)o

name: Eyhz
comment: It's been really great to get to know all kinds of people and producers, either just to chat with or learn from, and I'm glad I'm able to take part in these projects.

name: ANGELWHISPER
comment: I discovered KodamaSounds when a friend sent me a link to them asking for more arrangers for MIDNIGHT SYNDROME. This led me down the road of working on so many albums, KodamaSounds or otherwise, and I am so grateful. MIDNIGHT SYNDROME was such an amazing album to work on and it felt amazing to find my way into this community. Big thanks to Robin for her ability to somehow undertake the monumental task of organising these albums so consistently.

name: malicent
comment: I'm really glad I had the oportunity to participate in this amazing project. Before, I never had the chance to show what I can do to other people, wether that's producing music or helping other people for them to reach their desired sound, and KodamaSounds' project helped me to improve myself to the point I feel more confident with what I can do. Most of the time I'm behind the scene helping tracks to reach their biggest potential, but this time I'm upfront and sharing what I like to make, so I hope you enjoy it! Thank you so much for everything!!

name: Yuutou
comment: I'm typically very shy when it comes to collaborating on albums that are group projects like this. I've wanted to participate more, but because of my poor memory and with how easily I get distracted, I keep forgetting. The same thing kind of happened with this song, I got invited and completely forgot until a month before it was due... (¬¥‚àÄÔΩÄÔºõ) I like working with KodamaSounds though. Robin is very nice and understanding, and any time I'm able to participate, I do my best to. Everyone in the circle is so incredibly skilled at what they do, and every song I hear from the others blows me away! It keeps me inspired to get even better at music, I want to reach a point where my music elicits emotions from the people that listen to it. Everyone's been wearing tougher masks lately, but I've always wanted my music to be a cushion for people to relax and listen to, if only to be themselves for a moment. I'll do my best to keep getting even better, and I hope to continue to show up in more KodamaSounds projects in the future! Happy 5th anniversary!

name: LibriJamm
comment: Happy 5th Anniversary. Don't really have much to say here. I'm not the sentimental type. So in short, Thanks Ms. R for reaching out and gathering everyone together all those years ago. The project's really expanded huh. So when do we get lore? There needs to be a recommended album listening order. Thanks to the people conversing in the many group chats. I don't interact much with you, but I'm glad you're having fun and creating a welcome space for others. I'm sure that by being yourselves you are making someone else very happy. And thanks to the submissions team for putting up with me submitting songs on the exact due date. I swear I'm not doing this on purpose. I do start them months in advance. But it just keeps happening. ...Eto blehh

name: Transendium
comment: Â∏åÊúõÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÁπºÁ∫åÂ§öÂ§öÊîØÊåÅKodamaSoundsÁöÑÂ∞àËºØÔºÅ<3 Hope everyone continues to support KodamaSounds' amazing album projects! <3

name: Raphtalix
comment: Congrats on the 5th anniversary of KodamaSounds! It hasn‚Äôt been that long since I joined, but I‚Äôm grateful and honored to have contributed to the projects and to be a part of KodamaSounds as a Sound Staff. I look forward to create more awesome things with KodamaSounds!

name: Yozu C
comment: KodamaSounds are Kingdom üëë. Filled with S-tier talented and creative Adventurers, and YGGDRASIL will be an epic adventures (I'm sure).

name: Alkome
comment: Happy 5th Anniversary to KodamaSounds. Since YGGDRASIL allowed a free theme, I created a track in the hardcore style I've worked on the most.

name: Before The Storm
comment: Being part of the YGGDRASIL project is a great experience, and I‚Äôm thankful for the chance to contribute to KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary. It‚Äôs always inspiring to see how music connects people from all over the world, and I‚Äôm happy to be part of this journey with so many creative minds involved.

name: Volumetrique
comment: Hi. Volumetrique here. I'm only the messenger but I also wanted to put nice words about KodamaSounds for the 5th year anniversary. I've been introduced to KodamaSounds and Robin through a common friend, around the era of UPRISING. We became good friends, and I've tried to be helpful in many ways, on the label and as a friend. Being able to join her workforce, which radiates with passion and talent, has been a major highlight of the last couple years of mine. Here's to so much more. Vive la France. #kodamasweep

name: Casio Lamb
comment: Thank you so much to KodamaSounds for musical motivation. Without the opportunities they've offered, I'd have been stuck making tracks for few ears to listen to. The community Robin has built up is strong and passionate, and I am grateful to contribute to it.

name: Mitomoro
comment: KodamaSounds has been extremely fun and professional to work with. I truly appreciate them giving me a home for some tunes as I come back from an extended hiatus of sorts. You can thank them directly for getting my ass back in the game because if I didn't agree to give them music I would just keep sitting on it. Much love and Respect, Mito <3

name: r
comment: Thank you for inviting to the album.

name: Monochrome
comment: I first learned about KodamaSounds in 2023 when I stumbled across a Twitter post from them. At this time, I had only a few months ago decided I wanted to pursue music composition professionally, and I was looking for communities I could contribute to, so I could build a portfolio. At the tail end of 2023, I made my first KodamaSounds appearance on Katamania!! -a Katamari tribute album-. Since then, I've gotten heavily involved in Kodama's albums. The ECLECTIC RESONANCE series in particular has been an immensely fun and valuable challenge in diversifying my portfolio and skillset, and I've greatly enjoyed maintaining a streak of appearances (up until Memories 2, so sad). Every album theme has given me new inspiration and new avenues of exploring and refining my sound, and I unquestionably would not be the musician I am today without the consistency of Kodama's projects. 2 years after my first Kodama appearance, I'm back once again to deliver a track for this 5th anniversary album. In terms of both my prowess and my career, a lot has changed in that relatively short time. I am the most confident producer I can be right now, and I have notable game composing credits to my name, which seemed a distant impossibility back in 2023. The journey to these achievements was made with KodamaSounds being a constant spotlight on my portfolio. I'm proud to be a small piece of the circle's history, enough to have the privilege of being on YGGDRASIL.

name: Foodbot
comment: When the owner approached me to make a song for YGGDRASIL, when I can make "anything I want", I got so many crazy ideas that I quickly got overwhelmed... However I'm still happy with this end product, so please enjoy it if you can!!

name: Exteria
comment: I really love the community, such friendly and talented people! Thanks so much for these compilations and opportunities during these 5 years!

name: Ludicin
comment: Actually my first time participating! I have been reached out to before to be a part of their other compilations, but I haven't been able to participate unfortunately, so I'm glad to be able to participate this time for their 5th Anniversary.

name: V0iD
comment: That rush when something clicks at 3 a.m. and you just know it works. Its fun working with Kodama.

name: GOETIŒõ
comment: 5 Years!!!!!!!, how has it gone by so quickly? Having released Scabra Tangat Fidei at the same time as Gensokyo Party Vol. 1, I feel especially that I've grown alongside KodamaSounds, and not just in age. In terms of favourite KodamaSounds release, definitely Escapism. trance just hits differently when you need it. For this album specifically, it's my biggest project so far, with the playlist count at ~240. I like the 2nd half a lot. In relation to my experience making music over these years, I suppose I just make stuff I like, definitely improved a lot with composition, sound design, mixing, mastering, well everything really since 2020/1, and certainly a million times better than when i started at the end of 2015. Though, too often it feels like an exercise in futility.

name: Faxyne / idosa
comment: This is my first release on KodamaSounds as Faxyne, I had previously worked under the 'idosa' moniker. Although I may not have participated to a lot of releases on the label, I'm impressed at how big it has become and I had a pleasant time making music for this compilation in a "make whatever you want" state of mind! Happy birthday :)))

name: Asayami / ReeK
comment: Working with KodamaSounds is pretty fun and actually pretty engaging. even though my planning of deadlines and stuff sucks absolute donkey ****. and the fact that there are so many musicians and producers and DTMers of wide varieties of genre, makes this even more fun for someone genrefluid like me! I see KDMS as a "hub" or a "center station" of every "sub-community" in the DTM space. there's ALWAYS someone I know from other servers or communities I'm in. Here's to more Compilations, more singles, more chuuni, more ARF ARF, more fumos, more missed deadlines because ADHD - and most importantly: MORE FUN DTM THINGS

name: Zeth
comment: hello! i've been a part of KodamaSounds for around 2 years, mainly contributing in the form of designing the album covers that many came to enjoy and love - very happy about all the support people have given to us and our works, music and art wise! i hope that people will keep finding cool artists from our works and we will keep putting out more banger projects in the future so stay tuned! here's to many more years of KodamaSounds \o/

name: Yanis
comment: 5 years huh... I've been contributing to Kodama for the last 4 years or so, and despite my insecurities on my japanese level, I did my best to make the circle just a bit more international. Seeing a lot of new japanese artists working with us made me really happy. Spending all those years studying wasn't for nothing... is what I always think when I listen to all those wonderful songs from the japanese artists we could work with. And now I'm on the path of making my dream come true, and I hope I'll be able to be the face of Kodama in Japan! Let's keep growing and touch many more hearts üî•

name: krz
comment: i ‚ù§Ô∏è nextjs

name: Doggibelle
comment: I remember being gifted a copy of Gensokyo Party Vol.1 in 2020 right at the beginning of KodamaSounds. Seeing the growth of KodamaSounds over the years is mind-blowing, and I'm very proud of Robin and every artist that contributed to this. Even if I mainly work in the shadows as a web developer, I'm glad to be part of this üíñ

name: VIIweights
comment: perhaps there‚Äôs a chance that i'll be doing more than just webdesign for Kodama next year

name: NForza
comment: I'm glad to have helped with the label's reach if only a little.

name: marklincadet
comment: I have had the honor to work with Robin and cal on Memories 1&2, and am extremely proud of what we accomplished on both. They are passionate about music and the people behind them moreso, which I like to think shows in the final products. We might be different as people and often vary in our opinions, but I believe that the albums turned out amazing because we dared to speak out to each other on areas to improve, and make a decision as a team by hook or by crook before moving on. Thank you Robin for reaching out two years ago to take me on this ride, to cal and your eagle eye for talent and detail, and to everyone else I've had the pleasure of working with and listening to for these two albums!

name: Supire
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary! I‚Äôll always cheer you on.

name: KaNa
comment: Congratulations to KodamaSounds on its 5th anniversary and the release of the commemorative album "YGGDRASIL"! I first participated in a KodamaSounds project with the track "Halcyon" from ECLECTIC RESONANCE Escapism. I‚Äôm truly happy to be part of a label filled with people who are so passionate about music. I‚Äôm also looking forward to collaborating with the label again on new works in the future!

name: Kurokotei
comment: [insert gronyan here]

name: Muscises
comment: I'm incredibly grateful to contribute to a doujin circle like KodamaSounds. As someone who has been trying to kickstart their music as a means to be financially sound and collaborative, it was very difficult back in 2018 since I was just in the cusp of starting to get good at writing compositions for general audiences. However, I noticed that the usual methods of advertising yourself and getting gigs was not feasible especially with the advent of COVID lock-downs so I went back to my roots and started participating in music jams for fun. I guess that's where I caught a lot of attention, and figured I would be a good fit for something. Well, that something happened with Memories being worked on and I figured it would be cool to put out a chiptune track done in MML to show that yes there are people in the West that are invested into making music in this fashion that's commonplace in Japan. From there, everything started to fall into place and now I'm part of three music circles and done collaborative efforts for people's albums or even some singles for fun. The ultimate lesson I can give to creatives is to never be afraid of venturing out to creative spaces that are new to you, and also to give respect to creatives of all backgrounds and skill levels because we look up to each other for anything that we might need help with which is key in order to progress the culture we are invested and cultivated in. There's a quote that I have given myself years ago, and it's that I always strive to be "Unquotable, Unpredicatable, and Unsuitable". Ironic I know, but it's up to interpretation and it's more fun that way. :D

name: Len
comment: le fishe au chocolat

name: Guo
comment: Very funny and happy!

name: Haykira
comment: I was very flattered to have been chosen to work on the cover and visual identity of ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories 2's pixel art. The staff was really nice and everything ended up pretty smoothly, with very interesting exchanges of ideas and feedback! I felt like I was truly working with a passionated bunch, one which was really mindful of every minute detail. It's definitely something we should do again!! I'm really proud to have been able to bake something for a KodamaSounds compilation which got a physical release!

name: Princess Sylvysprit
comment: KodamaSounds has given me the oppurtunity to work alongside many fellow awesome musicians, some which i have known for years, and some which i have had the pleasure of meeting only recently, but one thing is for certain; making music with you all is fun, and i say let's continue expressing ourselves together!

name: fusoxide
comment: Congrats on KodamaSounds' fifth anniversary! So far, I have only participated in one album, ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories - it can be difficult to find spare time and energy to participate in album projects in general. It was an honor to contribute though, and I am still proud of the track "miami galaxy" that I composed. KS also inspired me to start my own music circle, Technomarina! I love the idea of gathering artists together to all make great music, especially when lesser known ones are involved. Hope I can participate in more KS projects in the future!

name: hasu
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary! Your music activities that cross borders are truly wonderful. I‚Äôm praying for your growing success and development. I‚Äôm looking forward to another project I can participate in.

name: Ray_Oh
comment: I‚Äôm looking forward to your activities that lead to your 10th anniversary.

name: U-Ruri
comment: Congratulations on your 5th anniversary! This is U-Ruri, who participated in ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories 2. I feel that KodamaSounds handles genres that are not often covered elsewhere, and I really like that aspect. Wishing you all the best in the years to come!

name: Shauno Isomura
comment: It‚Äôs not too long ago that I contributed to the ECLECTIC RESONANCE Legendaria album, but it really meant a lot to me as this was my very first original music release! It allowed me to get to know and connect with many great young composers too! KodamaSounds has so many amazing albums and composers with them and I just can't wait to hear what is in store for the near future - Congratulations for 5 years!

name: utzbo
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary! I participated in two KodamaSounds‚Äô projects until now, but both were good experiences! Outside of those two, there‚Äôs a lot of other projects that seem interesting, so if the opportunity arises, I‚Äôd be glad to participate in those as well!

name: DJKurara
comment: This was one big compilation, and it's been quite a while since the last time I got to collaborate on a project, which was a lot of fun. Congratulations on your 5th anniversary!

name: tenko
comment: KodamaSounds was my first time really being able to take part in a compilation album, and I have been and will always feel honored and grateful to have had the opportunity to do so. I hope there will be more and more opportunities to come for me to participate under KodamaSounds again. Thank you and Happy 5th Anniversary!!

name: LCS
comment: Five years already... so wild to me. It was so much fun contributing to some of the early albums, I regret not having the time to submit more. But hopefully sometime soon! It's been wonderful hearing all the amazing tracks people have put together over the years, and I'm of course excited to see what new projects are created in the next few years :)

name: MEMODEMO
comment: KodamaSounds is 5 years old! They grow up so fast :,)

name: SomeSpoonyBard
comment: As an artist, I feel I tend to stick to a small number of circles, so being invited to participate in a KodamaSounds release was a nice way to branch out from my usual comfort zone. All the administrators have been very professional with me, and available to answer any questions I had about the process. I hope to find the opportunity in the future to work with them again.

name: Scramel
comment: I'm really grateful to be part of KodamaSounds. I had the opportunity to meet a lot of really talented artists, take part in special projects, and overall, be able to enjoy making music related to my favourite media out there in a community that cares about the smaller indie scene. It has grown a lot since I first joined, and I hope it only continues to grow up!

name: acrouzet
comment: I'm glad to have been invited to put my music out there with this group of talented artists. They provided good feedback and were very supportive, teaching me a couple things I'll keep in mind as I continue music making.

name: tom_atom
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary! I contributed to ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories 2, and it was a huge stimulus for my music composition activities. By listening to other artists‚Äô songs, I felt like the scope of what I could express grew larger and larger. All of your projects are wonderful and really stimulating, so I‚Äôm looking forward to the next one I may be able to contribute to! Keep doing your best, I‚Äôm cheering you on from the bottom of my heart! Onward to KodamaSounds‚Äô 10th anniversary!

name: g3ntlebreeze
comment: getting invited to participate in ~Dawn~ in 2021 was a very important moment for me. i primarily work on video game OSTs, but have always had trouble working on songs just for myself. it can be hard for me to feel creative/inspired/motivated when working on a original song rather than one for accompanying media. making a track for ~Dawn~ gave me confidence in my own original work, and seeing people's positive reactions to my track was so motivating! since then, working on songs for Kodama's comps is something i eagerly look forward to. i love how supportive and talented the community is. forever grateful to be part of the Kodama family :3

name: MegaStrike
comment: First of all, i want to say thank you to Fivda for publishing my music, but more importantly, believing my music for KodamaSounds. As a person who mostly create music for media (Video games and animations), KodamaSounds let me explore the more unique side of the music world. I can meet other musicians that create radically different genres from what i usually make. I even met some of them in real life! I will definitely continue to release more music under KodamaSounds.

name: ak+q
comment: I have only released once on KodamaSounds, but the experience was very nice! The team allows for creative expression and an outlet for all kind of musical expression. I appreciate everything the team as done and all the accomplishments over the years!

name: Aethral
comment: It's been an honor to contribute to the KodamaSounds catalog and witness its amazing growth over the past five years. Congratulations, and here's to many more years of great music!

name: SnugglyBun
comment: I only really submitted one song to this label, and tbh I wish i participated more since it seems really nice and wonderful. I just don't have the time, energy nor emotional willpower for this stuff rn... but hopefully there will be more KodamaSounds SnugglyBun music in here :3

name: jaxcheese
comment: I'm a relative newcomer to KodamaSounds but my few chances to work with them have all been joyful... it's wonderful that they take a chance on arrange projects for less-covered soundtracks, and the staff have always been kind and welcoming to me. Memories 2 is a monumental release and I'm so grateful I was encouraged to contribute. and joining my circle pxtunes with kodama and others for united tribute arrange force was a really memorable experience. thanks to the staff and all members! I wish you five more exciting years...

name: LSKR
comment: Working with KodamaSounds (for PARADISE) has been a very pleasant experience. It came at a perfect time in my life when I was in the midst of change in my creative endeavours and the diversely talented crowd of KodamaSounds' roster was exactly what I needed to get back on track. Thank you for the opportunity!

name: blobdash
comment: blorb

name: Coconami
comment: Kodama as a whole represents a lot of firsts that I went through in this journey. 1: The first large label that I contributed to (idk does Tsundere Violence count as large?). 2: The first time my name appeared in an XFD. 3: The first Touhou remix + experimental track I made. 4: The first time I actually received payment for my musical activities. 5: The first time I'm on an album with so many beloved artists of mine. 6: The first time Callio decided to grant me the green artist role in the ES server. It's quite endearing actually; Kodama as a whole hosts so many talented artists that it's really an honour to be part of it, even as a small starting point. Although I have not contributed anything to Kodama after e_4, there will definitely be albums that I can have ideas of and make something out of it. Thanks, to Robin, and to all.

name: sdhizumi
comment: 5Âë®Âπ¥„Åä„ÇÅ„Åß„Å®„ÅÜ„Åî„Åñ„ÅÑ„Åæ„ÅôÔºÅ„Ç≥„É¨„ÇØ„ÉÜ„Ç£„Éñ„Å®„Åó„Å¶„ÅÆ„Åì„Å†„Çè„Çä„ÇíÊåÅ„Å£„Åü„É™„É™„Éº„Çπ„Å´‰ªäÂæå„ÇÇÊúüÂæÖ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

name: scythe
comment: Happy 5th Anniversary! It‚Äôs truly an honor to have been able to participate in "Memories" twice. I sincerely hope that KodamaSounds, where amazing composers from all over the world gather, will continue to grow and flourish even more in the future!

name: Xeudo Code
comment: KodamaSounds always had the coolest project to work on with the coolest people. What's even better is that they are always open for smaller artists as well. Congratulations on 5th anniversary and I hope this goes on for much longer.

name: MetaMusic
comment: KodamaSounds is a wonderful community, and it's been an incredibly welcoming space for me to spread my wings and experiment. I've grown as a musician in many ways thanks to Kodama, and I can't wait to participate more in the future. Thanks for the (ECLECTIC RESONANCE) Memories, here's to five more years of fantastic music <3

name: yeowool
comment: congratulations to KodamaSounds' 5th year anniversary! i'm honored enough so have participated in one of their releases, and the way the whole release was structured in advance, in a way i've never seen before in any other places, was impressive and fascinating to see. hope to be a part of KodamaSounds' release again someday too, until then! ü§é

name: Ko-Shan
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary! Thank you for inviting me to ECLECTIC RESONANCE UPRISING 3! You‚Äôre managing everything really well and craft wonderful projects, you‚Äôre a really unique and powerful label. Keep doing your best!

name: Cororo
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary! Let‚Äôs make the doujin music scene even stronger together. Cheering you on from Japan!

name: Lila Mellark
comment: I was floored at the quality of projects and their artists, 5 years sounds like a lot but it's also a very short time to have released so many high quality projects. I hope I can work with you all again!

name: sanmal
comment: Congratulations on KodamaSounds‚Äô 5th anniversary and the release of YGGDRASIL! I made three songs with KodamaSounds until now, and it was a really pleasant experience. Especially Purity; it was the first time I challenged myself to make a trancey Track, and it‚Äôs my favorite track between those three. Let‚Äôs keep enjoying music together in the future!

name: soothingMelody
comment: I discovered KodamaSounds through a tweet inviting people to join for their When They Cry tribute album, Fragments of Gratitude. I am still so happy I decided to take the chance, being in a community around so many like minded people, working on music together has pushed me so much as an artist and I wouldn't trade that experience for the world. It opened a lot of opportunities for me and for that I can never thank it enough. I  You are all awesome and you do incredible work, I wouldn't be half the composer I am without you.  Thank you for existing, KodamaSounds. Happy 5th Anniversary.

name: Miner4ever
comment: I'm really surprised to see that KodamaSounds have reached its 5th Anniversary! It really shows how fast time has gone on, as I believed that I have joined this place in its 2nd year or so. Even though I haven't participated in any events ever since Dusk/Dawn, I still listen to the albums and songs KodamaSounds artists have released, and all I can say is compared to myself, I still have a long way to go. For my experience in releasing music in Kodama... Well at least for the only two albums I released, I would say it's very straightforward. Make what you love, explore what you haven't been able to (a.k.a. getting out of your comfortzone) and use your creativity to synthesize something everyone in your community will listen to. I really want to know what the YGGDRASIL project is about, but it might be a big one...

name: Emelia K.
comment: Happy 5th anniversary. Let the doujin music flow.

name: Krep
comment: It was so much fun to work as a musician for ECLECTIC RESONANCE ~Dawn~ and as a pixel artist for the ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories album cover üíñ

name: Tektheist
comment: Doujin music never dies, Doujin or death!

name: AKA
comment: Happy 5th anniversary to KodamaSounds!!!! I had so much fun singing on "L√©gendes". The project was filled with such passion and my favorite people. Thank you for having me. To many more years and future wonderful projects ahead!

name: SJC
comment: Happy 5th Anniversary, KodamaSounds! Witnessing your journey over the past five years and seeing the circle grow into the impressive scale it is today has been truly moving. Congratulations on this milestone, and here‚Äôs to even greater heights!

name: ViRiX Dreamcore
comment: Working with KodamaSounds has given me the chance to meet and collaborate with extremely talented people. I was even introduced to new games I hadn't played. While I typically produce electronic and jazz fusion, working with this community has broadened my composition skills and musical understanding. KodamaSounds is truly something special.

name: Manof
comment: Thank you so much Fivda for asking to do not one but two cover for the two Detuned Alloy albums! I hope in the near future that I will continue to be commissioned to do the illustrations for the upcoming 39845 Detuned Alloy albums. See you bye bye!

name: Tater
comment: I enjoyed the production quite a bit, and I expect I'll submit to certain future releases as well. I was introduced to the KodamaSounds Memories 2 album by two people in the community, and after participating, I recognized a bunch of other artists I'm mutuals with.

name: Round Wave Crusher
comment: It's been great to work with KodamaSounds. I hope we can continue to collaborate in the near future. Keep Crushing. BRRRRR!!!

name: Fivda
comment: I've always lived a hectic life of art and creativity. Every few years, my tastes change greatly, and so do my projects. Years back, I don't think I could imagine myself in the position I am today. I think I can confidently say that KodamaSounds is the best thing I've ever created of my life. It's insane to me that we've gone this far, and there is no sign of stopping. It has made me meet hundreds of amazing friends and artists, and it made me learn from my mistakes and successes to grow better as a person. I am eternally thankful to all of the artists that have trusted me, and helped me make this dream a reality. I am looking forward to the future in a way I couldn't have ever imagined. Thank you! #KODAMASWEEP
